name: Rajgad Fort
description: Rajgad was the capital of the Maratha Empire under Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj for almost 26 years. The fort is known for its historical significance and stunning views.

startingPoint.name: Gunjavane Village
startingPoint.description: Small village at the base of Rajgad with basic amenities

summer.conditions: Hot during day, carry extra water

waypoints.description: Plateau with camping space and water

name: Dudhsagar Waterfalls
description: One of India's tallest waterfalls, Dudhsagar creates a spectacular milky cascade. Best visited during monsoon season.

camping.reason: Protected forest area, camping not permitted

monsoon.recommendation: Best time to visit for waterfall experience

winter.conditions: Reduced water flow, pleasant weather, clear skies
winter.recommendation: Good for photography and easy access

summer.conditions: Minimal water flow, hot and humid
summer.recommendation: Not recommended, waterfall may be dry

name: Bhimashankar Trek
description: One of the 12 Jyotirlingas, this trek combines spirituality with nature. Dense forests and wildlife sanctuary.

monsoon.recommendation: Beautiful but challenging, carry leech socks

winter.conditions: Pleasant weather, clear trails, best wildlife viewing
winter.recommendation: Perfect time for trekking and wildlife photography

summer.conditions: Hot during day, carry extra water, early morning start

name: Lohagad Fort

name: Torna Fort
description: First fort captured by Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj at age 16. Also known as Prachandagad, it's the highest hill fort around Pune.

description: Famous 'Dark Forest' trek through dense jungle canopy. Known for its unique descending trail and rich biodiversity in the Western Ghats.

name: Rajmachi Fort
description: Rajmachi comprises two hill forts—Shrivardhan (~3000 ft) and Manaranjan (~2700 ft)—famous for lush forest trails, fireflies, camping, sunrise views, Kataldhar waterfall and twin fort ruins.

startingPoint.name: Udhewadi Village
startingPoint.description: Udhewadi (Rajmachi village) lies 16 km from Lonavala by forest road or 10 km by Karjat route; it's the base for both forts.

networkAvailability.emergencyContact: 108/112; signal only near village or summit

waterSources: None mid-trail; streams at dry season unreliable
foodOptions: Pack snacks; no stalls en route
recommendations: Carry 3–4 L water, energy snacks, dry fruits

camping.cost: ₹600–700 per person for food + ₹600 per tent

permits.entry: ₹5 per person + vehicle tax (₹100/4‑wheeler; ₹20/2‑wheeler) collected by locals
permits.timings: Trek is open year‑round; camping allowed; night trekking popular but riskier

monsoon.conditions: Lush trails, fireflies, slippery rock sections
monsoon.recommendation: Ideal for campers; caution advised on trail

winter.conditions: Clear skies, cool weather, perfect for trekking

trekRoute.totalDistance: 16 km via Lonavala; 10 km via Karjat route
trekRoute.ascent: 350 m to Udhewadi + ~300 m to Shrivardhan
trekRoute.difficulty: Easy to Moderate; forest roads and paved sections, mild rocky climb

waypoints.name: Shrivardhan Fort
waypoints.description: Main fort with water tanks and view

byTrain.description: Mumbai to Lonavala (local/express); then auto/jeep to Tungarli dam/Udhewadi
steps: Local train to Lonavala
Auto to Tungarli dam/Udhewadi
Trek to Udhewadi
Continue to fort

byBus.description: MSRTC to Lonavala, then local transport as above

byPrivateVehicle.description: Drive via Mumbai–Pune Expressway, park at Lonavala or near village (off-road required)
byPrivateVehicle.warning: 16 km off-road; high‑clearance vehicle needed monsoon

byTrain.description: Pune → Lonavala train, then same local transport

byBus.description: MSRTC to Lonavala + local transport

bestTimeToVisit: October to February (winter); monsoon for fireflies experience

name: Harishchandragad
description: Harishchandragad is a historic hill fort in the Sahyadri range, known for its challenging treks, ancient caves, and the magnificent Konkankada cliff. It offers panoramic views of the surrounding valleys and peaks, making it a popular destination for trekkers and nature enthusiasts. Key attractions include the Kedareshwar Cave, Harishchandreshwar Temple, and Taramati Shikhar.

startingPoint.name: Pachnai Village / Khireshwar Village
startingPoint.description: There are two main starting points: Pachnai, which is the easiest route (2-3 hours to top), and Khireshwar, which is more challenging (4-5 hours to top) and passes through the Junnar region. Both are accessible by public transport and private vehicles.

networkAvailability.emergencyContact: Pre-trek notification advised. Dial 108/112 in case of network availability. No dedicated medical/rescue post on trek.

homestays.name: Several local homestays
homestays.contact: Check locally or through trek organizers

foodAccommodation.foodOnTrek: Basic food (Pithla Bhakri, Maggie, Tea) available at small shacks near the temple/caves on the fort. Carry packed meals for the trek.
foodAccommodation.waterSources: Natural springs near the temple and Kedareshwar cave (reliable during and post-monsoon). Carry sufficient water (2-3L minimum).
foodAccommodation.campingOptions: Allowed in the caves (like Kedareshwar cave surroundings) or open ground on the fort plateau. Bring your own tents and sleeping bags.

nearestMedicalFacility.name: Primary Health Centre
nearestMedicalFacility.contact: Local emergency numbers will be provided by villagers.

emergencyNumbers.localRescueVolunteers: Local villagers are often the first responders; connect with them upon arrival.

localGuides.name: Various local guides
localGuides.contact: Available in Pachnai and Khireshwar villages. Inquire upon arrival.
localGuides.ratePerPerson: ₹500-1000 (negotiable based on group size and services)

trail: Pachnai Route: Relatively straightforward climb from Pachnai village directly to the fort plateau.
Khireshwar Route: Begins from Khireshwar, passes through Tolar Khind, and involves a steep climb and rock patches before reaching the fort.
landmarks: Kedareshwar Cave (with a Shiva Lingam surrounded by water)
alternativeRoutes: Nalichi Vaat (extremely difficult, requires technical climbing skills and equipment)
seasonalNotes: Monsoon: Lush green, waterfalls, but very slippery and foggy. Best for views of Konkankada and clouds.
Winter: Ideal for trekking with clear skies and pleasant weather.
Summer: Very hot, carry extra water.

permitInfo.howToApply: No permit needed for individuals or groups.
permitInfo.timingRestrictions: No specific timing restrictions, but advisable to start early for safety and to avoid heat. Overnight camping is common.

name: Lingmala Waterfalls

name: Peb Fort (Vikatgad)
description: Peb Fort, also known as Vikatgad, is a scenic hill fort near Matheran. The trail passes through lush forest, rocky patches, and features a thrilling ladder climb near the top. It offers views of Neral, Matheran hill station, and nearby Sahyadri ranges.

startingPoint.name: Neral (Anandwadi)
startingPoint.description: Neral is well connected via local trains from Mumbai and Pune. Anandwadi is a 15–20 min walk from Neral station and serves as the entry point to the trail.

networkAvailability.emergencyContact: Pre-trek notification advised. Dial 108/112 in case of network availability. No dedicated medical/rescue post on trek.

foodAccommodation.foodOnTrek: No food stalls mid-trek. Tea and snacks available in Neral only. Carry packed meals.
foodAccommodation.waterSources: Small streams during monsoon; unreliable during dry season. Carry 2L minimum.
foodAccommodation.campingOptions: Allowed near Anandwadi fields or summit cave with sleeping bags. No official campsites.

trail: Start from Anandwadi village near Neral.
Walk along toy train track from marker 134 NM → 155 NM.
Turn into forest trail after marker 155.
Rocky climb with exposed ridge walk.
Reach iron ladder and climb to summit plateau.
Explore caves, Datta temple, and flagpole.
alternativeRoutes: From Matheran via Sunset Point ridge (longer)
seasonalNotes: Monsoon: lush & slippery, Summer: dry but hot, Winter: best for clear views

permitInfo.howToApply: No permit needed for individuals or groups.
permitInfo.timingRestrictions: Avoid after sunset. Local police may stop overnight campers during monsoon.

name: Bhivpuri Waterfalls
description: A popular waterfall destination near Karjat, perfect for day trips and family outings. Multiple small waterfalls create natural pools.

startingPoint.name: Bhivpuri Village
startingPoint.description: Well-developed base with good facilities for tourists

byTrain.description: Train to Karjat, then local transport
steps: Take train from Mumbai CST to Karjat Railway Station
From Karjat, take auto/taxi to Bhivpuri Village
Short walk to waterfall area

byBus.description: Bus to Karjat, then local transport
steps: Take MSRTC bus from Mumbai to Karjat
From Karjat, take local transport to Bhivpuri Village
Walk to waterfall
Take Mumbai-Pune Highway to Karjat exit
Drive to Bhivpuri Village via local roads
Park at village and walk to falls

byTrain.description: Train to Karjat via Lonavala
steps: Take train from Pune to Lonavala, then to Karjat
From Karjat, take auto/taxi to Bhivpuri Village
Short walk to waterfall area

byBus.description: Bus to Karjat via Mumbai route
steps: Take PMPML bus from Pune to Mumbai, get down at Karjat
From Karjat, take local transport to Bhivpuri Village
Walk to waterfall
Take Pune-Mumbai Highway to Karjat
Drive to Bhivpuri Village via local roads
Park at village and walk to falls
